titles.title: Zena ʾAyhud “History of the Jews” / Apostolic Epistles / Tǝrgwame ʾAbräksis, Сommentary on the Acts of the Apostles / Homily by John Chrysostom on the Lord's Prayer / Ḥasabä säʿatat, Computus

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Zena ʾAyhud “History of the Jews” (fols. 5ra-158vb) II) Apostolic Epistles (fols. 161ra-168rb) II-1) Mälʾǝktä Ṗeṭros qädamawi “First Epistle of Peter” [1 Peter] (fols. 161ra-163rb) II-2) Mälʾǝktä Ṗeṭros dagǝmawi “Second Epistle of Peter” [2 Peter] (fols. 163rb-164rb) II-3) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs qädamawi “First Epistle of John” [1 John] (fols. 164rb-166ra) II-4) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs dagǝmawi “Second Epistle of John” [2 John] (fols. 166ra-rb) II-5) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs śalǝsawi “Third Epistle of John” [3 John] (fol. 166rb) II-6 ) Mälʾǝktä Yaʿqob “Epistle of Jacob” [Jas.] (fols. 166rb-167vb) II-7) Mälʾǝktä Yǝhuda “Epistle of Judah” [Jude] (fols. 167vb-168rb) III) Tǝrgwame ʾAbräksis, Commentary on the Acts of the Apostles (fols. 168rb-vb), unidentified IV) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Lord's Prayer (fols. 168vb-172rb) (cp. Ms. BN éth. 157, no. 3, ZotBNat 257-58) V) Ḥasabä säʿatat, Computus (fols. 172rb-173rb)
Additio 1.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been resewn. The spine cover has been cut off. Fols. 1, 3, 4, 173-177 are slightly damaged by insects. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 3, 14, 48, 79, 83, 98, 112, 137, 141, 154, 155, 175, 177.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, corni-form, x-form, cross hatching).

bnothers.bnother: Two rows of small holes are visible on the spine folds of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

txfolios.txfolio: Number 66 has been omitted; fol. 65 is followed by fol. 67.

squires.squire:
A(4; s.l.: 1, stub after 4; 3, stub after 2/fols. 1r-4v) — ፩I፩(10/fols. 5r-14v) — ፪II፪(10/fols. 15r-24v) — ፫III፫(10/fols. 25r-34v) — ፬IV፬(10/fols. 35r-44v) — ፭V፭(8/fols. 45r-54v) — ፮VI፮(10/fols. 55r-64v) — ፯VII፯(10/fols. 65r-75v) — ፰VIII፰(10/fols. 76r-85v) — ፱IX፱(10/fols. 86r-95v) — ፲X፲(10/fols. 96r-105v) — ፲፩XI፲፩(6/fols. 106r-115v) — ፲፪XII፲፪(10/fols. 116r-125v) — ፲፫XIII፲፫(10/fols. 126-135v) — ፲፬XIV፲፬(10/fols. 136r-145v) — ፲፭XV፲፭(10/fols. 146r-155v) — ፲፮XVI፲፮(4; s.l.: 1, stub after 4; 3, stub after 3/fols. 156r-159v) — ፲፯XVII፲፯(11; s.l.: 10, stub before 1/fols. 160r-170v) — ፲፰XVIII፲፰(7; s.l.: 4, stub after 4/fols. 171r-177v).
Quire XVI is reinforced with a long parchment guard inserted between leaves 1 and 2 on one side and after leaf 4, on the other.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (below the ruling on fols. 58r-61v). The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: A few lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page; two lines (alternating with a black line) in the incipit page of Text II; initial line or words of Texts II-1 to II-7 and III-V; initial line of sections introduced with the word “zenahu”; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The work contains an embedded colophon (copied together with the text) on fol. 158rb-vb. [fol. 158rb] ተፈጸመ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ ወልደ፡ ከርዮን፡ ካህን፡ ዘያየድዕ፡ ዜና፡ አይሁድ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤት፡ ዳግማዊ። ወዝክረ፡ ነገሥቶሙ፡ ወነገር፡ ዘኮነ፡ በመዋዕሊሆሙ፡ እም፡ አመ፡ ሕንጸተ፡ ቤት፡ ዳግማዊ፡ ወግአቶሙ፡ ኀቤሁ፡ እስከ፡ ተነሥተ፡ ወተፄወው፡ እምኔሁ። ስብሐት፡ ወአኰቴት። ዝማሬ፡ ወዕበይ፡ [fol. 158v] ስጊድ፡ ወክብር። ግናይ፡ ወውዳሴ፡ ክብር: ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ክቡር፡ ወልዑል። እስከ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም። ወለትውልደ፡ ትውልድ፡ ዘኢየሐልቅ፡ አሜን። ወአሜን፡ለይኩን፡ ለይኩ[sic] - Other mss. containing Zena ʾAyhud “History of the Jews” are, e.g.: EMML No. 4773 (16th/17th cent.), fols. 1a-108b (EMML X, 306) Orient. 822 (17th cent.) (WrBriMus no. 378, 288-289) Orient. 825 (18th cent.) (WrBriMus no. 379, 289) Orient. Rüpp. II, 2 (mid 18th cent.) (GoldFMRüp no. 2, 3-9). - For an edition s. M. KAMIL, Des Josef Ben Gorion (Jossipon) Geschichte der Juden: ዜና ፡ አይሁድ, nach den Handschriften in Berlin, London, Oxford, Paris und Strassburg, New York 1937.

additional.cont: Fol. 176r-v: Excerpt from Zena ˀAyhud “History of the Jews”.
additional.det: The excerpt is written in the main hand. It contains the same text as fol. 5r-v.

extras.extra: - The title of the Ms., ዜና፡ አይሁድ, and the internal number of the monastic library (306) are written on fol. 1r. - Sections of Text I are numbered in a modern hand, in pencil, up to fol. 30va. The last section number is 15. - Fols. 2, 4 and 174, used as endleaves, originate from an older ms. The text has been washed out. - Corrections written over erasures, in the main hand: fols. 5ra, 7v, 8rb, 18va, 24ra, 46rb, 47vb, 50vb, 72ra, 72vb, 76rb, 84va, 89ra, 92va, 115ra, 128vb, 145ra, 156va. - Erasures marked with thin lines: fols. 8va, 15vb, 60ra, 67vb, 74ra, 90va, 102rb (with three asterisks), 103rb, 114va, 116vb, 121va, 130vb, 133va, 136va, 138va.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written twice, in the left corner of the upper margin and in the left corner of the bottom margin of the first and the last fol. of the quire: fols. 5r, 14v, 15r, 24v, 25r, 34v, 35r, 44v, 45r, 54v, 55r, 64v, 65r, 75v, 76r, 85v, 86r, 95v, 96r, 105, 106r, 115v, 116r, 125v, 126r, 135v, 136r, 145v, 146r, 155v, 156r, 159v, 160r, 170v, 171r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Coloured threads inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 125 (blue), 140 (white and red).
